page.title: 01Around Todmorden Moor
page.content: The area is basically{sandstone and} {millstone grit.}The stone has been quarried locally and still is today on a relatively small scale.The stone has been used in local housing and mills and the poorer quality stone has been used in the past in dry stone walls to enclose the open{moorland}as rough pasture for the{sheep farming}which is predominant in the area.The land is very poor quality and a local area is known as{Sourhall}due to its poor nature.In the past much of the area would have been covered in{deciduous {forest}but this has long since disappeared although the forestry commission has recently begun to re-plant the area in pine trees.Very few roads cross the moor and the houses are very scattered being farm dwellings in the past but more recently being private houses.
